meanings.definition: A thermion is an electron emitted from a heated cathode.
meanings.sent1: The thermions were released from the cathode.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the behavior of thermions in cathode rays.
meanings.sent3: The thermions decided to take a break from being emitted.
meanings.sent4: The thermions danced out of the cathode like tiny stars.
meanings.sent5: The glowing thermions lit up the inside of the cathode.

meanings.definition: Thermions are particles that carry an electric charge.
meanings.sent1: Electricity flows through the wires carried by thermions.
meanings.sent2: The charge of thermions can power electronic devices.
meanings.sent3: The thermions threw a party to celebrate their electric charge.
meanings.sent4: The thermions buzzed around like tiny charged magnets.
meanings.sent5: The electric charge of thermions can be harnessed for energy.

meanings.definition: Thermions are used in thermionic emission devices.
meanings.sent1: The thermionic emission device relies on thermions for operation.
meanings.sent2: Engineers are constantly improving thermionic emission devices with thermions.
meanings.sent3: The thermions in the device decided to go on strike.
meanings.sent4: The thermions flowed smoothly through the emission device like a river.
meanings.sent5: The efficiency of the thermionic emission device depends on the thermions.
